LanguageData.GR_ParagonBear.label: ursine paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBear.description: The absolute alpha of units, the chonkiest of bois, winner of consecutive Fat Bear Weeks before being disqualified due to winning too often.\n\nA perfect ursine animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon has a particularly powerful stun attack and can be slaughtered for a valuable pelt, which can either be used for decoration or sold.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBear.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBear.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBear.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBoomalope.label: boomalope paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBoomalope.description: While more of a risk to keep around, they are considerably more efficient and don’t eat your crops as much. Plus their permanent sad expression just makes you want to pet them, how can you say no.\n\nA perfect boomalope animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon produces deepchem instead and explodes on death in a much more violent fashion.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonBoomalope.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonChicken.label: avian paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonChicken.description: Sure the little blighter is more stubborn than its progenitor, but not having to gather the eggs so often and a bigger fried egg makes all the difference.\n\nA perfect avian animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon possesses inherent wildness not present in domesticated chickens but is more likely to stay put.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonChicken.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_ParagonChicken.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonMuffalo.label: muffalo paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonMuffalo.description: A return to simpler times, when everyone could have sworn blind that muffalos used to be able to produce milk but were instead fooled by hornless paragons.\n\nA perfect muffalo animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon also produces milk and can be slaughtered for a valuable pelt, which can either be used for decoration or sold.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonMuffalo.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonWolf.label: canine paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonWolf.description: An improved version of man’s best friend, easier to train, more assertive and dangerous to those that threaten a household. Sadly, far too proud to admit it really wants a belly rub.\n\nA perfect canine animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon can be slaughtered for a valuable pelt, which can either be used for decoration or sold.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonWolf.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonWolf.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonWolf.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonRat.label: rodent paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonRat.description: Look, I know what you’re thinking. Why is the rat the paragon of all rodents? And even if you’re not thinking that, this is rhetorical anyway so there. What other rodent has caused civilization to collapse due to poorly held beliefs and lack of proper hygiene. As such, we give you the King Rat. Or Queen Rat, if you want a whole colony showing up.\n\nA perfect rodent animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon has a very fast gestation period and its attacks transmit the plague.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonRat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonRat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonRat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonIguana.label: reptile paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonIguana.description: Small and venomous, with a deadly fart, not quite what one was expecting for the perfect reptilian form. I mean, you’d think you’d get a tyrannosaurus rex or something but no, it seems that the humble iguana is here to stay. If anything, the shock of something so small moving so fast has got to be worth something.\n\nA perfect reptile animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon is oviparous and can manually rupture neck sacs containing venomous gas.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonIguana.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonIguana.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonIguana.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHorse.label: equine paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHorse.description: The most majestic of horses is proud and magnificent, and doesn’t care for your rules, man. So keep them properly penned up, because they’ll try to escape to freedom so they can run wild and free. And then wonder where all the carrots, sugar cubes and salt licks have disappeared to.\n\nA perfect equine animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon makes for an excellent mount and pack animal for caravans.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHorse.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHorse.tools.1.label: left hoof
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHorse.tools.2.label: right hoof
LanguageData.GR_ParagonThrumbo.label: colossal paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonThrumbo.description: The gigantic, graceful creature has somehow been improved even further, proving infallibly that there’s always a taller mountain. Significantly easier to train and with a more efficient digestive system, this creature is possibly how the thrumbo originally was when first bred in a lab before it got tainted through terraforming.\n\nA perfect colossal animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon makes for an excellent mount for caravans and can forcibly rush itself, getting faster and creating dust clouds that impede ranged attacks.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonThrumbo.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_ParagonThrumbo.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_ParagonThrumbo.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_ParagonThrumbo.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHumanoid.label: humanoid paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHumanoid.description:
There is a saying that all of life is a circle, and that eventually everything returns to its origins only to begin again. This particular humanoid has undergone some mental evolution while at the same time suffering from physical devolution, resembling more closely humanity’s distant evolutionary ancestors. Just don’t say monkey.

A perfect humanoid animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon can drive man’s curiosity ever forward by providing a boost to research speed with a well-placed insightful word of wisdom.

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Humanoid paragons will periodically engage other colonists in conversation, talking about a variety of topics. This increases the social recreation needs of those they interact with by 10% (subject to diminishing returns like all joy types). If using Ideology, humanoid hybrids are subject to precepts. Research drive ability: offers investigative insights to nearby researches, allowing them to more easily reach a breakthrough by increasing research speed by 10%.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHumanoid.tools.0.label: left fist
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHumanoid.tools.1.label: right fist
LanguageData.GR_ParagonHumanoid.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonFeline.label: feline paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonFeline.description:
An incredible, large fur baby that not only wants you to scratch its belly, but regularly and without fear of getting your eyes gouged out by their massive claws. Also they’re smart enough to go after prey less than half their size, but that’s more so they don’t have to spend so much time grooming themselves afterwards.

A perfect feline animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon is incredibly intelligent and can be properly trained with minimal retraining, as well as being an excellent and affectionate companion.

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability and a short nuzzle period. Cat reflexes ability: twice per day, it can use an ability that gives it further melee capabilities.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonFeline.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonFeline.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_ParagonFeline.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ParagonInsectoid.label: insectoid paragon
LanguageData.GR_ParagonInsectoid.description:
A terrifying callback to the original Sorne geneline, this mobile hive was originally designed to engage the mechanoid enemy head-on. By carrying an entire colony of insects with hardened mandibles, their ability to practically disassemble the mechanical menace proved just as effective at turning against their human overlords.

A perfect insectoid animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon is extremely intelligent and carries a dangerous brood of warrior flies. A burst of pheromones summons the drones to protect their hive and queen, shredding apart all other nearby creatures.

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> All insectoid hybrids have good armor and no toxic sensitivity, but they are always sterile and can't reproduce, even if a fertility booster is used to create them. Insect clouds ability: twice a day it can create insect clouds around it that damage any animal crossing them, except insectoid paragons, which are immune.
LanguageData.GR_ParagonInsectoid.tools.1.label: head
